meanings.definition: Plural form of vacuus, meaning empty space or void.
meanings.sent1: The vacua between the stars seemed endless.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with vacua after the furniture was removed.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the vacua in his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vacua, devoid of any thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The vacua in the abandoned house echoed with emptiness.

meanings.definition: Plural form of vacuus, meaning a state of emptiness or lack of content.
meanings.sent1: The vacua in the fridge indicated it was time to go grocery shopping.
meanings.sent2: His speech was full of vacua, lacking any real substance.
meanings.sent3: The party was a vacua of fun, with no music or games.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a vacua, empty and cold.
meanings.sent5: The vacua in the library shelves showed that many books were missing.

meanings.definition: Plural form of vacuus, meaning a state of being empty or devoid of matter.
meanings.sent1: The vacua in the jar made it clear that the cookies were all gone.
meanings.sent2: The vacua in the parking lot indicated it was a slow day for shopping.
meanings.sent3: His promises were just vacua, with no real intention behind them.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house stood as a vacua of past memories.
meanings.sent5: The vacua in her eyes revealed the sadness she tried to hide.
